Its flowers are typically yellow with a red center, and it produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Abelmoschus vitifolius is often cultivated for its edible pods, which are used in various cuisines.
distribution_native_art_desc: Abelmoschus vitifolius is primarily native to southern and eastern Africa, including countries such as South Africa, Kenya, Tanzania, and Mozambique. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions with warm climates and well-drained soils. This plant is commonly found in savannahs, grasslands, and along riverbanks. It is often used for its edible seeds and has cultural significance in some local communities. Its natural range extends into parts of the Arabian Peninsula as well.
